pullRequest.title: Added Content Response on Write Enabled feature to CosmosItemRequestOptions
pullRequest.bodyText:
Added contentResponseOnWriteEnabled field to CosmosItemRequestOptions
This field if set true or false, will override whatever is set in CosmosClientBuilder for this particular request on to which these options are passed.
By default, value of this field is null, because to support cases where customer has set this field in CosmosClientBuilder as true and wants to enable or disable the content response for an individual requests.
Improved testing scenarios with all combinations for this field in CosmosClientBuilder and CosmosItemRequestOptions
Feature request - #16076
Closes - #16076

commit.message: Added Content Response on Write Enabled feature to CosmosItemRequestOptions

nodes.bodyText:
two comments:

previously we had the notion of document/resource. Now there is not resource notion anywhere in our api or javadoc.
I would change "resource" to payload or data item.
"this removes the resource from response". Instead of saying "remove", I would reword this to say service doesn't return the payload. as it may become confusing what "removing" means.

same for the setter api.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -203,6 +204,51 @@ public CosmosItemRequestOptions setSessionToken(String sessionToken) {
         return this;
     }
 
+    /**
+     * Gets the boolean to only return the headers and status code in Cosmos DB response
+     * in case of Create, Update and Delete operations on CosmosItem.
+     *
+     * If set to false, this removes the resource from response. It reduces networking
+     * and CPU load by not sending the resource back over the network and serializing it on the client.
+     *
+     * This feature does not impact RU usage for read or write operations.
+     *
+     * NOTE: This flag is also present on {@link com.azure.cosmos.CosmosClientBuilder},
+     * however if specified on {@link CosmosItemRequestOptions},
+     * it will override the value specified in {@link com.azure.cosmos.CosmosClientBuilder} for this request.
+     *
+     * By-default, this is null.
+     *
+     * @return a boolean indicating whether resource will be included in the response or not for this request.
+     */
+    public Boolean isContentResponseOnWriteEnabled() {
+        return contentResponseOnWriteEnabled;
+    }
+

+     * Sets the boolean to only return the headers and status code in Cosmos DB response
+     * in case of Create, Update and Delete operations on CosmosItem.
+     *
+     * If set to false, this removes the resource from response. It reduces networking

commit.message: Updated javadocs - replaced resource with payload
